definition: to leap to (a higher position etc)/to jump/(of a plane) to ascend
to ascend/to rise to the rank of/to promote/to hoist/liter/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth dou 斗[dou3]

sentences.english: Architects' vertical leapfrogging, however, isn't likely to stop at the Burj Khalifa.
sentences.chinese: 然而建築師們的垂直躍升遊戲並不太可能就此止步。

sentences.english: Similarly, Beijing will leap from 38th to 17th place.
sentences.chinese: 同樣，北京將從第38名躍升至第17名。

sentences.english: From homogenized to martinis at lunch.
sentences.chinese: 午餐從均質牛奶躍升爲馬蒂尼。

sentences.english: This school's enrollment quotas have surged by a large margin.
sentences.chinese: 這個學校的升學率大幅度躍升。

sentences.english: Expectations, he quickly jumped ahead of the pack before.
sentences.chinese: 期望，他迅速地向前躍升前的包。

sentences.english: Calculations for some gas-field emissions jumped by several hundred percent.
sentences.chinese: 一些氣田排放量的計算結果躍升了數倍。

definition: to continue in a post/(to hold a post) several times in succession/(to win a title) in successive years/to stay at number one/to defend a championship
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to monopolize/to take on responsibility over everything/to undertake the whole task
to increase steadily/to grow with each passing day
private business/opposite: state-owned enterprise 國有企業|国有企业[guo2 you3 qi3 ye4]
